about_the_game: This game allows players to procedurally generate a 3D dungeon composed of worlds that are connected via portals. The player must collect all the objectives scattered across the dungeon in an order specified by the tutorial. The player must avoid enemies scattered across the dungeon. To collect the objectives, the player has the following tools: opening/closing portals, rotating the world they reside in, walking, and jumping. The game will test the player's movement in a 3D environment, understanding of the physics of the game, and memory of landmarks. The game has a minimalist design: simple shapes and colors. The game was made by a single developer. Have fun!

content_descriptors.notes: There's a single non-graphic death scene.

detailed_description: This game allows players to procedurally generate a 3D dungeon composed of worlds that are connected via portals. The player must collect all the objectives scattered across the dungeon in an order specified by the tutorial. The player must avoid enemies scattered across the dungeon. To collect the objectives, the player has the following tools: opening/closing portals, rotating the world they reside in, walking, and jumping. The game will test the player's movement in a 3D environment, understanding of the physics of the game, and memory of landmarks. The game has a minimalist design: simple shapes and colors. The game was made by a single developer. Have fun!
name: Tear

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-7700K
  • Memory: 12 GB RAM
  • Graphics: GTX 1060
  • Storage: 62 MB available space
  • Sound Card: None
  • VR Support: No
  • Additional Notes: This game has no sound
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system

short_description: A 3D, procedurally generated, dungeon/maze filled with objectives and dangers. It is composed of worlds that the player navigates through via walking, portals and rotating the worlds. Don't get lost and have fun.
